title: Jiangmei (Ruby) Xiong
text:
I’m currently a Ph.D. candidate at Vanderbilt University Department of Biostatistics. I am primarily working with single-cell imaging data, and in particular with colorectal-cancer-related data. I occasionally dab in public health related social media data as well. I find great motivation in developing statistical method that aids the research in basic sciences, and I also love reading about statistical thinking from different perspectives.




Ph.D. in Biostatistics, Vanderbilt University | Nashville, TN
M.A. in Statistics, Columbia University | New York, NY
Bachelor of Actuarial Studies, Aunstralian National University | Canberra, ACT, Australia








GammaGateR: semi-automated marker gating for single-cell multiplexed imaging Xiong, J., Kaur, H., Heiser, C. N., McKinley, E. T., Roland, J. T., Coffey, R. J., Shrubsole, M. J., Wrobel, J., Ma, S., Lau, K. S., & Vandekar, S. https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2023.09.20.558645v1
Digital Surveillance for Monitoring Environmental Health Threats: A Case Study Capturing Public Opinion from Twitter about the 2019 Chennai Water Crisis  Xiong, J., Hswen, Y. and Naslund, J.A. International journal of environmental research and public health 17.14 (2020): 5077. https://www.mdpi.com/1660-4601/17/14/5077



GammaGateR | Marker-gating tool based off cfGMM. Friendly for large datasets, along with informative interactive diagnostic plots. | 2023
cfGMM | Closed-form Gamma Mixture Model. Makes fitting Gamma Mixture Model so much faster! (than the traditional MLE version) | 2021

title: About
text: Now that you choose to read this tab, I assume you are interested in knowing more details about my research. Here you can read about the document I wrote for my orals, which gives a brief introduction to the type of data I look at, my first paper and my future directions.
